Description: A Product-Centric Delivery Coach is responsible for guiding and coaching teams on delivering value to customers through product-centric approaches. They work closely with product owners and development teams to ensure that the product vision is clear and that the team is aligned around delivering customer value.

Required.SkillDescription: Expertise in product management principles and practices, and the ability to guide and coach teams in delivering high-quality products that meet customer needs
Deep understanding of Agile methodologies, and the ability to guide and coach teams in implementing and optimizing these practices for product development
Ability to manage and lead cross-functional teams, and to coordinate team efforts across multiple departments and business units
Ability to manage stakeholder expectations and relationships, and to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to drive continuous improvement for product development practices and tools, and to identify opportunities for optimization and efficiency gains

Recommended.SkillDescription: Expertise in Lean product management principles and practices, and the ability to guide and coach teams in implementing and optimizing these practices for product development

Understanding of Agile scaling frameworks such as Scrum@Scale, Nexus, and Spotify Model, and the ability to guide and coach organizations in implementing and optimizing these frameworks for product development
Understanding of design thinking principles and practices, and the ability to guide and coach teams in using these practices to create customer-centric products
Strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Strong facilitation skills, and the ability to lead meetings and workshops that promote effective communication and collaboration
Ability to design and deliver effective Agile training and development programs for individuals and teams

Strong understanding of the business context in which product development practices are implemented, and the ability to align product development practices with the goals and objectives of the organization
Ability to develop and execute strategic plans for product development, and to align these plans with the goals and objectives of the organization
Ability to provide leadership and mentorship to individuals and teams, and to create a culture of innovation and continuous improvement
Ability to foster a culture of innovation and creativity within teams, and to promote the development of new and innovative product solutions
Ability to facilitate effective collaboration among individuals and teams, and to promote a culture of knowledge sharing and cross-functional teamwork
Ability to develop and implement product strategies that align with the goals and objectives of the organization, and that drive business growth and innovation
Ability to develop and communicate product roadmaps that align with the goals and objectives of the organization, and that guide the product development process
